verses.verse: "I <S%H3772>made<s%> a <S%H1285>covenant<s%> with my <S%H5869>eyes,<s%> how then should I <S%H995>look<s%> lustfully at a young <S%H1330>woman?<s%>
For what is the <S%H2506>portion<s%> from <S%H433>God<s%> <S%H4605>above,<s%> and the <S%H5159>heritage<s%> from the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%> on <S%H4791>high?<s%>
Is it not <S%H343>calamity<s%> to the <S%H5767>unrighteous,<s%> and <S%H5235>disaster<s%> to the <S%H6466>workers<s%> of <S%H205>iniquity?<s%>
<S%H7200>Doesn't<s%> he see my <S%H1870>ways,<s%> and <S%H5608>number<s%> all my <S%H6806>steps?<s%>
"If I have <S%H1980>walked<s%> with <S%H7723>falsehood,<s%> and my <S%H7272>foot<s%> has <S%H2363>hurried<s%> to <S%H4820>deceit<s%>
(let me be <S%H8254>weighed<s%> in an <S%H6664>even<s%> <S%H3976>balance,<s%> that <S%H433>God<s%> may <S%H3045>know<s%> my <S%H8538>integrity<s%>);

if my <S%H838>step<s%> has turned <S%H5186>out<s%> of the <S%H1870>way,<s%> if my <S%H3820>heart<s%> <S%H1980>walked<s%> <S%H310>after<s%> my <S%H5869>eyes,<s%> if any <S%H3971>defilement<s%> has <S%H1692>stuck<s%> to my <S%H3709>hands,<s%>
then let me <S%H2232>sow,<s%> and let <S%H312>another<s%> <S%H398>eat.<s%> <S%H6631>Yes,<s%> let the produce of my field be rooted <S%H8327>out.<s%>
"If my <S%H3820>heart<s%> has been <S%H6601>enticed<s%> to a <S%H802>woman,<s%> and I have laid <S%H693>wait<s%> at my <S%H7453>neighbor<s%>'s <S%H6607>door,<s%>
then let my <S%H802>wife<s%> <S%H2912>grind<s%> for <S%H312>another,<s%> and let <S%H312>others<s%> sleep with <S%H3766>her.<s%>
For that would be a heinous <S%H2154>crime.<s%> <S%H5771>Yes,<s%> it would be an iniquity to be punished by the <S%H6414>judges:<s%>
For it is a <S%H784>fire<s%> that <S%H398>consumes<s%> to <S%H11>destruction,<s%> and would root <S%H8327>out<s%> all my <S%H8393>increase.<s%>
"If I have <S%H3988>despised<s%> the <S%H4941>cause<s%> of my <S%H5650>male<s%> servant or of my <S%H519>female<s%> <S%H7379>servant,<s%> when they contended with me;
What then shall I <S%H6213>do<s%> when <S%H410>God<s%> rises <S%H6965>up?<s%> When he <S%H6485>visits,<s%> what shall I answer <S%H7725>him?<s%>
<S%H6213>Didn't<s%> he who made me in the <S%H990>womb<s%> <S%H6213>make<s%> <S%H259>him?<s%> Didn't one <S%H3559>fashion<s%> us in the <S%H7358>womb?<s%>
"If I have <S%H4513>withheld<s%> the <S%H1800>poor<s%> from their <S%H2656>desire,<s%> or have caused the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of the <S%H490>widow<s%> to <S%H3615>fail,<s%>
or have <S%H398>eaten<s%> my <S%H6595>morsel<s%> <S%H3490>alone,<s%> and the fatherless has not eaten of <S%H398>it<s%>
<S%H5271>(no,<s%> from my youth he grew <S%H1431>up<s%> with me as with a <S%H1>father,<s%> her have I <S%H5148>guided<s%> from my <S%H517>mother<s%>'s <S%H990>womb<s%>);
if I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> any <S%H6>perish<s%> for want of <S%H3830>clothing,<s%> or that the <S%H34>needy<s%> had no <S%H3682>covering;<s%>
if his <S%H2504>heart<s%> <S%H1288>hasn't<s%> blessed <S%H2552>me,<s%> if he hasn't been warmed with my <S%H3532>sheep<s%>'s <S%H1488>fleece;<s%>
if I have lifted <S%H5130>up<s%> my <S%H3027>hand<s%> against the <S%H3490>fatherless,<s%> because I <S%H7200>saw<s%> my <S%H5833>help<s%> in the <S%H8179>gate,<s%>
then let my shoulder <S%H5307>fall<s%> from the shoulder <S%H7929>blade,<s%> and my <S%H248>arm<s%> be <S%H7665>broken<s%> from the <S%H7070>bone.<s%>
For <S%H343>calamity<s%> from <S%H410>God<s%> is a <S%H6343>terror<s%> to <S%H7613>me.<s%> Because his majesty, I can do <S%H3201>nothing.<s%>
"If I have <S%H7760>made<s%> <S%H2091>gold<s%> my <S%H3689>hope,<s%> and have <S%H559>said<s%> to the fine <S%H3800>gold,<s%> <S%H4009><s%> 'You are my confidence;'
If I have <S%H8055>rejoiced<s%> because my <S%H2428>wealth<s%> was <S%H7227>great,<s%> and because my <S%H3027>hand<s%> had <S%H4672>gotten<s%> <S%H3524>much;<s%>
if I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> the <S%H216>sun<s%> when it <S%H1984>shined,<s%> or the <S%H3394>moon<s%> <S%H1980>moving<s%> in <S%H3368>splendor,<s%>
and my <S%H3820>heart<s%> has been <S%H5643>secretly<s%> <S%H6601>enticed,<s%> and my <S%H3027>hand<s%> threw a <S%H5401>kiss<s%> from my <S%H6310>mouth,<s%>
this also would be an <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> to be punished by the <S%H6416>judges;<s%> for I should have <S%H3584>denied<s%> the <S%H410>God<s%> who is <S%H4605>above.<s%>
"If I have <S%H8055>rejoiced<s%> at the <S%H6365>destruction<s%> of him who <S%H8130>hated<s%> <S%H5782>me,<s%> or lifted up myself when <S%H7451>evil<s%> found <S%H4672>him;<s%>
<S%H5414>(yes,<s%> I have not allowed my <S%H2441>mouth<s%> to <S%H2398>sin<s%> by <S%H7592>asking<s%> his <S%H5315>life<s%> with a <S%H423>curse<s%>);
if the <S%H4962>men<s%> of my <S%H168>tent<s%> have not <S%H559>said,<s%> <S%H5414><s%> 'Who can find one who has not been <S%H7646>filled<s%> with his <S%H1320>meat?<s%>'
(the <S%H1616>foreigner<s%> has not <S%H3885>lodged<s%> in the <S%H2351>street,<s%> but I have <S%H6605>opened<s%> my <S%H1817>doors<s%> to the <S%H734>traveler<s%>);
if like <S%H121>Adam<s%> I have <S%H3680>covered<s%> my <S%H6588>transgressions,<s%> by <S%H2934>hiding<s%> my <S%H5771>iniquity<s%> in my <S%H2243>heart,<s%>

because I <S%H6206>feared<s%> the <S%H7227>great<s%> <S%H1995>multitude,<s%> and the <S%H937>contempt<s%> of <S%H4940>families<s%> <S%H2865>terrified<s%> <S%H1826>me,<s%> so that I kept silence, and <S%H3318>didn't<s%> go out of the <S%H6607>door<s%>â€”

oh <S%H5414>that<s%> I had one to <S%H8085>hear<s%> <S%H8420>me!<s%> (behold, here is my signature, let the <S%H7706>Almighty<s%> <S%H6030>answer<s%> <S%H376>me<s%>); let the accuser <S%H3789>write<s%> my <S%H5612>indictment!<s%>
Surely I would <S%H5375>carry<s%> it on my <S%H7926>shoulder;<s%> and I would <S%H6029>bind<s%> it to me as a <S%H5850>crown.<s%>
I would <S%H5046>declare<s%> to him the <S%H4557>number<s%> of my <S%H6806>steps.<s%> as a <S%H5057>prince<s%> would I go near to <S%H7126>him.<s%>
If my <S%H127>land<s%> <S%H2199>cries<s%> out against <S%H3162>me,<s%> and its <S%H8525>furrows<s%> weep <S%H1058>together;<s%>
if I have <S%H398>eaten<s%> its <S%H3581>fruits<s%> without <S%H3701>money,<s%> or have caused its <S%H1167>owners<s%> to <S%H5301>lose<s%> their <S%H5315>life,<s%>
let <S%H2336>briars<s%> <S%H3318>grow<s%> instead of <S%H2406>wheat,<s%> and <S%H890>stinkweed<s%> instead of <S%H8184>barley.<s%>" The <S%H1697>words<s%> of <S%H347>Job<s%> are <S%H8552>ended.<s%>
